member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.DatabaseErrorPageExtensions.UseDatabaseErrorPage(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary: Captures synchronous and asynchronous database related exceptions from the pipeline that may be resolved using Entity Framework migrations. When these exceptions occur an HTML response with details of possible actions to resolve the issue is generated.
member.param: The to register the middleware with.
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.DatabaseErrorPageMiddleware
member.summary: Captures synchronous and asynchronous database related exceptions from the pipeline that may be resolved using Entity Framework migrations. When these exceptions occur an HTML response with details of possible actions to resolve the issue is generated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.DatabaseErrorPageMiddleware.#ctor(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.RequestDelegate,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory,Microsoft.Extensions.Options.IOptions{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.DatabaseErrorPageOptions})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class
member.param: Delegate to execute the next piece of middleware in the request pipeline.
The for the application. This middleware both produces logging messages and consumes them to detect database related exception.
The options to control what information is displayed on the error page.

member.summary: Process an individual request.

member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.MigrationsEndPointMiddleware
member.summary: Processes requests to execute migrations operations. The middleware will listen for requests to the path configured in the supplied options.

member.summary: Entity Framework recorded that the current exception was due to a failed database operation. Attempting to show database error page.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.Strings.FormatDatabaseErrorPage_Matched
member.summary: Entity Framework recorded that the current exception was due to a failed database operation. Attempting to show database error page.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.Strings.DatabaseErrorPage_NoRecordedException
member.summary: Entity Framework did not record any exceptions due to failed database operations. This means the current exception is not a failed Entity Framework database operation, or the current exception occurred from a DbContext that was not obtained from request services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.Strings.FormatDatabaseErrorPage_NoRecordedException
member.summary: Entity Framework did not record any exceptions due to failed database operations. This means the current exception is not a failed Entity Framework database operation, or the current exception occurred from a DbContext that was not obtained from request services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.Strings.DatabaseErrorPage_NotRelationalDatabase
member.summary: The target data store is not a relational database. Skipping the database error page.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.Strings.FormatDatabaseErrorPage_NotRelationalDatabase
member.summary: The target data store is not a relational database. Skipping the database error page.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.Strings.DatabaseErrorPage_NoMatch
member.summary: The current exception (and its inner exceptions) do not match the last exception Entity Framework recorded due to a failed database operation. This means the database operation exception was handled and another exception occurred later in the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.EntityFrameworkCore.Strings.FormatDatabaseErrorPage_NoMatch
member.summary: The current exception (and its inner exceptions) do not match the last exception Entity Framework recorded due to a failed database operation. This means the database operation exception was handled and another exception occurred later in the request.
